name: Identity Engine Limited EA - For Customers
description:
This Postman collection is intended for customers that is selected for using Identity Engine for Limited EA.

It helps admins set up factor profiles and features as well as policies and includes a description for each section to explain how to do so. Various variables such as `inlineHookId`, `groupId`, `defaultUserTypeId` and `appInstanceId` are placeholders for real values that admins must substitute.

folders.name: Adoption
folders.description: Adoption feature determines how a factor profile is being adopted.

folders.name: Adoption
folders.description: Adoption feature determines how a factor profile is being adopted.

folders.name: Email
folders.description:
Requests related to Email Factor Profiles and Email Factor Profile Features.

In order to execute profile-specific requests in this section, the `emailFactorProfileId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first factor profile returned when you execute `List Email Factor Profiles` or when you execute `Create Email Factor Profile`.

folders.name: Enrollment Source
folders.description: Enrollment Source feature determines where the enrollment of a factor profile is sourced from.

folders.name: Factor Profiles
folders.description: Requests related to Factor Profiles and Factor Profile Features.

folders.name: Features
folders.description:
Requests related to the Password Factor Profiles Features.

In order to execute feature-specific requests in this section, feature-specific variables must be set. They are automatically set when you execute `List Features`.

folders.name: Features
folders.description:
Requests related to the Email Factor Profiles Features.

In order to execute feature-specific requests in this section, feature-specific variables must be set. They are automatically set when you execute `List Features`.

folders.name: IdP Routing Policy
folders.description:
Requests related to IdP Routing Policies and Rules.

In order to execute policy-specific requests in this section, the `idpRoutingPolicyId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy returned when you execute `List IdP Routing Policies`.

In order to execute policy rule-specific requests in this section, the `idpRoutingPolicyRuleId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy rule returned when you execute `List IdP Routing Rules in Policy` or when you execute `Create IdP Routing Rule in Policy`.

folders.name: Identifier Match Policy
folders.description:
Requests related to Identifier Match Policies and Rules.

In order to execute policy-specific requests in this section, the `identifierMatchPolicyId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy returned when you execute `List Identifier Match Policies`.

In order to execute policy rule-specific requests in this section, the `identifierMatchPolicyRuleId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy rule returned when you execute `List Identifier Match Rules in Policy` or when you execute `Create Identifier Match Rule in Policy`.

folders.name: Password
folders.description:
Requests related to Password Factor Profiles and Password Factor Profile Features.

In order to execute profile-specific requests in this section, the `passwordFactorProfileId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first factor profile returned when you execute `List Password Factor Profiles`.

folders.name: Policies
folders.description: Requests related to Policies and Rules.

folders.name: Recovery
folders.description: Recovery feature determines how a factor profile is being recovered.

folders.name: Recovery
folders.description: Recovery feature determines how a factor profile is being recovered.

folders.name: Reuse
folders.description: Reuse feature determines the reusability aspects of a factor profile.

folders.name: Sign On Policy
folders.description:
Requests related to Sign On Policies and Rules.

In order to execute policy-specific requests in this section, the `signOnPolicyId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy returned when you execute `List Sign On Policies` or when you execute `Create Sign On Policy`.

In order to execute policy mapping-specific requests in this section, the `signOnPolicyMappingId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy mapping returned when you execute `List Sign On Policy Mappings` or when you execute `Create Sign On Policy Mapping`.

In order to execute policy rule-specific requests in this section, the `signOnPolicyRuleId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy rule returned when you execute `List Sign On Rules in Policy` or when you execute `Create Sign On Rule in Policy`.

folders.name: String Validation
folders.description: String Validation feature determines how a factor profile validates strings.

folders.name: Token Security
folders.description: Token Security feature determines token security related aspects of a factor profile.

folders.name: Unknown User Policy
folders.description:
Requests related to Unknown User Policies and Rules.

In order to execute policy-specific requests in this section, the `unknownUserPolicyId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy returned when you execute `List Unknown User Policies`.

In order to execute policy rule-specific requests in this section, the `unknownUserPolicyRuleId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy rule returned when you execute `List Unknown User Rules in Policy` or when you execute `Create Unknown User Rule in Policy`.

folders.name: User Profile Policy
folders.description:
Requests related to User Profile Policies and Rules.

In order to execute policy-specific requests in this section, the `userProfilePolicyId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy returned when you execute `List User Profile Policies` or when you execute `Create User Profile Policy`.

In order to execute policy mapping-specific requests in this section, the `userProfilePolicyMappingId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy mapping returned when you execute `List User Profile Policy Mappings` or when you execute `Create User Profile Policy Mapping`.

In order to execute policy rule-specific requests in this section, the `userProfilePolicyRuleId` variable must be set. It is automatically set as the first policy rule returned when you execute `List User Profile Rules in Policy` or when you execute `Create User Profile Rule in Policy`.
